metadata.title: CVE-2021-3531 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Red Hat Ceph Storage RGW in versions before14.2.21. When processing a GET Request for a swift URL that ends with twoslashes it can cause the rgw to crash, resulting in a denial of service.The greatest threat to the system is of availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-base - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-common - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-fuse - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mds - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-cloud - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mgr-rook - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
ceph-mon - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1

ceph-resource-agents - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
cephadm - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
cephfs-shell - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcephfs-java - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcephfs-jni - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1

librados2 - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libradosstriper1 - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
librbd1 - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
librgw2 - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
python3-ceph - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
python3-ceph-argparse - 15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '15.2.12-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
